message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    String fullName = "John King IV. Cena";
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(fullName, " ");
    String firstName = st.nextToken();
    String middleName = "";
    String lastName = "";

    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
      String token = st.nextToken();
      if (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        middleName += token + " ";
      } else {
        lastName = token;
      }
    }

    System.out.println(firstName);
    System.out.println(middleName.trim());
    System.out.println(lastName);
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we use the StringTokenizer to split the fullName string into tokens using the space (" ") delimiter. We then retrieve the first token as the firstName. For the middleName, we iterate through the remaining tokens and append them to the middleName string, adding a space after each token. Finally, we assign the last token as the lastName. The middleName is trimmed to remove any leading or trailing spaces.
